abstracts.cdata!:
This program document presents a credit
            to the Republic of Uganda to finance the seventh Poverty
            Reduction Support Operation (PRSC7). Building on six
            preceding PRSCs, PRSC7 is the third and final operation in a
            programmatic development policy lending series to support
            Uganda's third Poverty Eradication Action Plan (PEAP)
            approved by the Cabinet in November 2004: The economic
            management component. The strategic objective is to maintain
            macro economic stability consistent with rapid private
            sector led growth. The PRSC support seeks to enhance budget
            rationalization in line with PEAP priorities and ensure
            efficient use of scarce resources. The enhance production,
            competitiveness and incomes component. The strategic
            objectives supported by the PRSC are: (i) efficient and
            competitive private sector; and (ii) increased and more
            efficient agricultural production, including increased
            marketing and increased access to land titling. The good
            governance. The strategic objectives supported by the PRSC
            are: (i) strengthened legal and justice systems including
            increased efficiency in the commercial justice; and (ii)
            transparent and efficient public financial management and
            public procurement. The human development component the
            strategic objectives supported by the PRSC are: (i) better
            educated society including increased access and quality of
            primary, secondary, and tertiary education; (ii) healthier
            Ugandans, including improved access, quality and utilization
            of health care services; improved sexual and reproductive
            health care services (obstetric, adolescent, and family
            planning services), and control of major communicable
            diseases (immunizable diseases, tuberculosis, malaria, and HIV/AIDS).
